thread.title: Syracuse Crunch cracks open new season by edging Lehigh Valley
thread.title_full: Syracuse Crunch cracks open new season by edging Lehigh Valley | syracuse.com

author: Syracuse Crunch
title: Syracuse Crunch cracks open new season by edging Lehigh Valley
text:
Jonathan Marchessault scored twice to push the Syracuse Crunch past the Lehigh Valley Phantoms 4-3 in the season opener tonight at the PPL Center.
Mike Blunden and Philippe Paradis also tallied for the Crunch, defenseman Dylan Blujus registered two assists and Anthony DeAngelo earned his first professional point.
Syracuse goaltender Kristers Gudlevskis picked up his first win of the season turning aside 26 of 29 shots. Lehigh Valley netminder Jason LaBarbera allowed four goals on 26 shots. The Crunch were unable to convert on one power-play opportunity, while the penalty kill unit went three-for-four.
The Crunch came out strong, tallying three goals in the first period. After a battle in front of the net, Blunden shoveled in the team's first goal of the season nine minutes into the opening frame. Captain Mike Angelidis and Henry Ikonen both earned a point for the assists.
At the 11:39 mark, the Phantoms evened the score while on the power play. Gudlevskis turned aside Taylor Leier's shot, but left the rebound out for Aaron Palushaj to chip in from the circle. Shayne Gostisbehere picked up the secondary assist.
Syracuse lit the lamp two more times before the first period came to an end. With 5:29 remaining, Joel Vermin dropped a pass to Marchessault, who beat LaBarbera from the slot. The secondary helper went to Blujus.
Paradis built up a three-goal lead for the Crunch with 1:22 left on the clock. DeAngelo started the play at the blue line by passing to Tanner Richard, who saucered a cross-crease feed for Paradis to rip one top shelf.
Marchessault kicked off the middle frame with his second goal of the game at the 6:07 mark. Jeff Tambellini pushed the puck to Blujus, who fed Marchessault at the point. His shot on LaBarbera was stopped, but he found his own rebound in the circle and beat the goaltender five-hole.
Three minutes later, the Phantoms cut the Crunch's lead to two when Chris Conner found the back of the net off assists from Pavel Padakin and Michael Parks.
Lehigh Valley struck again with 3:29 remaining in the contest. After a battle in front of the net, Danick Martel got the puck past Gudlevskis with the help of Conner and Nick Cousins.
Syracuse returns to the War Memorial Arena at 7 p.m. Saturday when it hosts the Binghamton Senators for the home opener presented by Upstate University Hospital.
Nice start to 2015-16! 4-3 win over Lehigh Valley. pic.twitter.com/uMMytJzDwI
— Jim Sarosy (@JimSarosy) October 11, 2015
